headline: Acorn Squash
description: Learn how to cook acorn squash with this easy recipe. Baking the squash with just butter and brown sugar turns it into a treat everyone will enjoy!

video.description: This baked acorn squash is buttery with just a smidge of sweetness.
video.name: Acorn Squash

name: Acorn Squash
recipeIngredient: 1 medium acorn squash, halved and seeded

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place acorn squash halves cut-side down onto a cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until flesh begins to soften, about 30 to 45 minutes.

Remove squash from the oven and transfer one squash half, cut-side up, to a deep baking dish. Spoon butter and brown sugar into the cavity. Place remaining squash half, cut-side down, over top to seal.
Return to the oven and continue to bake until flesh is soft, 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this last night, but instead of acorn squash and brown sugar, I got some pizza dough, tomato paste and made a pepperoni pizza…it was delish!!

We all loved this recipe for acorn squash. There wasn't as much brown sugar as the previous recipe I used so we enjoyed more of the taste of the squash as opposed to the sugar. I always roast the squash a little longer than suggested so it will be easier to take off the rind
Perfect! Not too sweet. Great for fall.

Quite good and a bit too sweet for us. I usually microwave squashes, also, like the other reviewer. For acorn, put the cut side down in a microwave-safe dish. Add 1/2 cup of water for each half. Zap for 10 mins., more or less, depending on your squash size. IF you want it to "crisp" up, put it in a hot oven for a few minutes.
Love the filling of butter and brown sugar, but I make it in my microwave usually since I don't always have the time to bake it. It is still wonderful though.
I added cinnamon and candied ginger(in syrup), chopped up. Mmm, mmm, delish
I make this recipe at least a couple times a month even during the summer. Delicious!!
I have made this recipe but add a tsp Of bourbon in each acorn half.
Loved this!! I simmered butter, brown sugar, tiny diced onion and poured that into squash! Yummy yummy yummy
I prepared this as shown on the recipe. It's delicious
Simply delicious.
I really liked this recipe. I probably added more brown sugar than needed but it was very tasty and sweet. Definitely a good side to put with a pielaf or salty dish.
It would have helped if the parchment paper on the cookie sheet had been mentioned here. It was in the video, but that didn’t show up until they had been in the oven for 10 minutes.
One of my fave Thanksgiving dishes!
Delicious. I cut the amount of butter in half, though. I plan to make this recipe without the butter next time.
Very good!
I increased the butter and brown sugar by 1/4, and added a dash of vanilla, cinnamon, and sprinkle of kosher salt.
Super easy! Followed as directed.
tasty,
It was easy and delicious. I have never had acorn squash before. The hardest part was cutting it.
This is a good old and great recipe what else can we say it’s a great go to.
This was simple and delish. I added butter, raw brown sugar and honey. Amazing taste of fall. Will make again.
I've made this for years and my mom made it when I was a child. Love it! Works great in oven or microwave
I loved this recipe. Made as written except added a chopped apple and, when baking second time, separated the squash instead of putting one half on top of the other. Will definitely make again
I did shorter time when. I put it in bakeing dish still soft and good !
Very good! I may not have baked it enough, and I would add some cinnamon next time. Will make this again.
I've made this recipe 3 times now and it is simple and delicious. I've also scooped out the cooked squash and pureed it too.
I’ve tried to make this myself just going on what I remembered from my mother and it never turned out right. I follow these directions and it’s perfect. ? I’ve made it three times now..?
It was delicious! Half the sugar and half the butter were great for us!
Tuned out perfectly!!

I make this all the time. Sometime I cook butter butternut squash along with the acorn squash and after they have cooked I scrap out the meat and mix them together. My family loves this combination. I also also add a 1/4 cup of dark molasses, dark brown sugar and butter and fry it in a cast iron pan on med heat till it is heated through.
Easy and good
Excellent! Quite filling. I used avocado plant-based butter, nutmeg, cinnamon, and agave syrup to flavor Acorn squash.

I used a non-dairy butter replacement to accommodate family food allergies. Was very good and everybody liked it.

I didn't like having to remove from oven to add butter and brown sugar and putting 'tops' on. Then when done, taking tops off and splitting butter /brown sugar mixture before serving.
Perfect!
Easy and so good. I also added some nufresh netmeg.
My husband and I loved it and it was so simple to make.
Turned out great. Instead of putting the halves together I added the butter and brown sugar to both sides and cooked for the additional 30mins.

After taking the halves out of the oven the first time, instead of placing one on the other in a dish and popping it back in, I’d recommend placing the two halves gave up on the pan you’re already using with the ingredients inside. They’ll stay face up on their own so don’t worry about them tipping!

Great recipe A+.....This is exactly how my dad use to to make acorn squash, thank you so much for the recipe I finally got to have it just like I remember growing up, now I can make it anytime for my little one.
Made as directed. These turned out perfectly.
Delicious, easy and using the oven kept my home warm!
Doubled the butter and brown sugar, because why not!
It’s an easy side to make. Delicious
my first try at baking ANY squash and this particular was picture perfect. Everything went according to recipe with little effort, thank you TERRYLEE51
I substituted maple syrup instead of brown sugar. It came out really nice and was easy to make. I will make it again.

Our family has made this recipe for years. The only difference is that we also dust the cut squash with cinnamon before baking. My mother also baked acorn squash with an undiluted can of cream of mushroom soup, split between the two halves of the squash. Either way, these are very tasty and a perfect side.

First I placed the cut squash in the microwave, about 10 mins, then into the oven for about 20 mins. Added the butter and sugar and cooked another 10. Came out very nicely with a sprinkle of cinnamon sugar on top!
I went with the maple syrup. Turned out good

In my version, I bake for half the cooking time, rubbed with olive oil, season each half with salt and pepper. Then to half; I add 1 Tbsp of Bourbon, the butter, brown sugar, along with a Tbsp'ish of raisins and then dust with cinnamon. Return to the oven for the remainder of the cooking time.
It was delicious and I add applesauce with cinnamon

Those suggesting microwave- microwave does not allow for the natural sugars to caramelize and create a deep, rich flavor. Just popped one in the oven. Cut in half, face down on police oil covered foil baking sheet. Will season, as recipe suggests! Yummy!

Had cooked acorn squash only once before and did not care for it much. When I found this recipe, I thought...oh well, I have the squash...here goes. The recipe seemed too simple! 
To make it faster, I used the InstaPot, cooking the halves for 15 minutes, then released the pressure. So well done they almost fell apart, so I put the mashed flesh into a oven proof bowl, added 2 T brown sugar, about a T of butter and a t of coconut oil. Sprinked 1/2 t of cinnamon on top and warmed it while something else was cooking (not necessary if already warm enough) and we devoured it....delicious! Will make for Thanksgiving dinner.
Huge hit in our house. My Son and Husband absolutely loved it... I love how healthy it all is and seeing my family enjoy eating this squash. So it’s a double win
Love it. I never had acorn squash so this recipe appealed to me. Taste like sweet potato pie with less calories and better nutrition
Just like my Mom used to make! This is probably my favorite way to make acorn squash!
Delicious and simple

Would have given it a 5 star for easy cooking! But there was WAY TOO MUCH BUTTER!
Needed 1 tsp. Butter 
 1 tsp. Brown sugar 
 1/2 tsp of CINNAMON
I added some water to the pan while they were upside down. I also added allspice into the brown sugar butter mixture. About 1/3 to 1/4 tsp with each half squash.
This turned out so good and so easy. Also a weight watchers zero point food.
sweet fall treat. Like other reviewers, i don't stack the halves, but cook them separately with the butter and sugar.
AWESOME

My dad made this when I was a kid, and it reminds me of him every time I make it.
I usually follow the recipe, but I sometimes mix it up by adding cinnamon and nutmeg, or honey instead of brown sugar. Believe it or not, adding a pinch of cayenne pepper makes it more flavorful.
Excellent recipe, came out perfectly!
Always a hit and super simple to make. I've also tryed it using chunky applesauce, cinnamon and butter with tasty results as well!
I followed the recipe, it was simple and delicious! It was my first time making and tasting acorn squash. I will be making it again!
So easy. I only added some pepper to the recipe.
So easy. I only added some pepper to the recipe.
Delicious!

I'll definitely make it again.
I prefer this over sweet potatoes.
Hubby prefers sweets because he's not fond of scooping the shell.

Only changes I made were method (5-6 minutes in the microwave, then 20 minutes in oven) and amounts of butter and sugar. I used 1 tsp. of butter in each half and had a pool of melted butter; I can't imagine a tablespoon per half! I used much less brown sugar too. As a kid, this was pretty much the only way we ate acorn squash. Thanks for the delicious memory! Will definitely make again.
A simple recipe for simply good squash.
I didn't change a thing and I wouldn't. This is the only way I make it. It's so delicious that I eat it as a meal!
Served with squash stuffed chicken breast. A great side. So tasty and simple.
ALONG W/ THE BUTTER AND BROWN SUGAR I ADD A 1/4 TEASPOON OF NUTMEG FOR ADDITIONAL FLAVOR.
This was ok, but the toppings didn’t seep through to the whole squash, so you could only taste it in the top layer...the rest was kind of bland.
Classic Fall/Winter dish. Delicious.

Have made this recipe several times with homegrown butternut squash, except using Monastery creamed honey (almond flavor) from the monks at Holy Cross Abbey in Berryville, Virginia instead of brown sugar. Delicious!
This recipe is both simple and tasty. I will certainly have it again.
I did this in the nuke machine for about 6.5 minutes and it came out rather hot but it turned out really good and soft.
I added a little honey and cinnamon
So simple, yet so good!
Excellent, and easy!
Very delicious! Just make sure to only put the amount of butter and brown sugar that is in the recipe. I added extra and it was too strong.

We grew acorn squash in our garden this year and only one made it. We weren't sure how to prepare it but followed this recipe using maple syrup instead of brown sugar and it was so good. I didn't realize that acorn squash already had a nutty, buttery taste so it was perfect. Now we will buy acorn squash and do this again!

I was able to make this in 40 minutes. Baked with the open side down for 15 minutes and then flipped them so the open side was up. Added 1T butter and 2T honey (I didn’t have brown sugar) and baked for another 25 minutes. It was very yummy!
Easy and Delicious!
Very good and easy to make.
Really good and easy to make.
This was so good I use to make this a lot years ago when squash was cheaper.

Came out very nicely. The flesh was soft and easy to get out. It seemed strange to put one half on top of the other. and it did make it a little harder to dole out the butter and brown sugar, but I think that may have helped make it cook evenly inside. I will make this one this way again.

I made sweet & spicy Acorn Squash. I used Coconut oil instead of butter. Then I added Chipotle Chilli pepper, chilli pepper, smoked Paparika, garlic powder & extra brown sugar. I also sliced my squash like cantelope. Very, Very good.
Yummy, I used Truvia brown sugar as we have a diabetic.
This recipe is really easy to make and is delicious! Yes, I will make again but will not put the top on the squash for the second half.
Very easy to make and it was delicious!!

I "cheated" and microwaved halves for 5 min like another reviewer before final baking, still just as fabulous when you're short on time. Also one time I accidentally used raw sugar instead of brown - still good but definitely not AS good :)
So delicious, you can also roast the seeds.
Easy. Delicious.
Add more butter more brown sugar and some maple syrup. It tastes like candied yams. Delicious but my family wasnt crazy about it. I made it for me 3 times this week
